definitions.definition: a person whose job is to act for, or manage the affairs of, other people in business, politics, etc.

examples.text: Our agent in New York deals with all US sales.
If you're going to rent out your house while you're abroad, you'll need someone **to act as your agent** here.
Typical agent's fees are around 6 per cent of the sale price.
I have an agent who deals with all my contracts.
The company has developed sales through local agents in key markets.
an agent for a shipping company

definitions.definition: a person whose job is to arrange work for an actor, musician, sports player, etc. or to find somebody who will publish a writer’s work

examples.text: If you want to get published, get yourself an agent!
She got the work through an agent.

definitions.definition: a person who works secretly to obtain information for a government or other organization

examples.text: She was operating as an undercover agent in London.
They were suspected of acting as enemy agents.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that has an important effect on a situation

examples.text: The charity has been an agent for social change.

definitions.definition: a chemical or a substance that produces an effect or a change or is used for a particular purpose
the person or thing that does an action (expressed as the subject of an active verb, or in a ‘by’ phrase with a passive verb)

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘someone or something that produces an effect’): from Latin agent- ‘doing’, from agere.
